results.title: Star trek: the motion picture
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Century Associates, Gene Roddenberry, Jon Povill and Robert Wise
results.brief_description: When a destructive space entity is spotted approaching Earth, Admiral Kirk resumes command of the Starship Enterprise in order to intercept, examine, and hopefully stop it. With it’s relentless flight towards Earth “V’ger’s” bloody-minded pursuit to find it’s “Creator”, Kirk and crew face possible Armageddon. Cast also includes Persis Khambatta as Lieutenant Ilia and Stephen Collins as Commander Decker. Interesting note: When Spock travels through V’ger and sees all the incredible imagery, look out for Darth Vader and Miss Piggy - right after his line “Who or what are we dealing with?”. Written by Allen Dean Foster. Original music by Jerry Goldsmith. Cinematography by Richard H. Kline.

results.title: Star trek III: the search for Spock
results.creator_credit: Harve Bennett Productions, Harve Bennett and Leonard Nimoy
results.brief_description: The third in the series of feature films based on the original television series by Gene Roddenberry is set in the 23rd Century, the planet Genesis has been born, but at a great and terrible price - the death of Captain Spock. As per tradition, his body is consigned to deep space and the battered starship Enterprise limps back home. Lt. Saavik and Dr. David Marcus arrive on the forbidden planet to begin their research, unaware that their discoveries are also of great importance to the Klingon Battle Commander Kruge (played by Christopher Lloyd), who will stop at nothing to gain control of the secrets of this new world for the Klingon Empire. The revelations regarding Genesis will impel Captain Kirk and the Enterprise crew on a mission so personal and dangerous that they will have to confront the final frontiers of revolutionary science and the arcane rituals of Vulcan mysticism. Cast includes William Shatner, DeForest Kelly, James Doohan, George Takei, Walter Keonig, Nichelle Nichols, Merrit Butrick and actor/director Leonard Nimoy, around whom the whole story revolves.

results.title: Star trek II: the wrath of Khan
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Robert Sallin and Nicholas Meyer
results.brief_description: It is the 23rd century and the starship U.S.S. Enterprise is on a routine training mission when an urgent communication from Space Laboratory Regula One (home of the Genesis project), is received by Admiral James T Kirk. Kirk’s old enemy, Khan, a genetically enhanced human from the Eugenics War, has appropriated a top secret device named Project Genesis and is using the universe threatening device in a deadly game of revenge. Aided by his band of genetic supermen made possible by the Project, Khan gains control of a Federation Starship and begins a desperate mission to gain control of the Enterprise. Cast includes William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and Kirstie Alley.

results.title: Stanley & Iris = Stanley and Iris
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Lantana Productions, Arlene Sellers, Alex Winitsky and Martin Ritt
results.brief_description: A feel-good romantic drama with a social conscience, “Stanley & Iris” tackles the serious problem of illiteracy which affects one out of every five American adults. Recently widowed and working mother of two teenage children, Iris (Jane Fonda) is struggling, both financially and emotionally. Stanley (Robert DeNiro) lives alone with his elderly father and is unable to read or write, a problem he has lived with for his entire life. The two meet when Stanley comes to the aid of Iris after her handbag is stolen, soon discovering that they are co-workers from the same local commercial bakery. And so begins a friendship. However, it is not long before Iris becomes aware of Stanley’s problem and when he eventually loses his job because of his illiteracy, Stanley asks for Iris’s help in teaching him to read. The bond of friendship and support gradually draws Stanley and Iris together into an affair of the heart. Strong performances by DeNiro and Fonda provide depth and soul into what could have been a somewhat schmaltzy and overly sentimental film. Cast also includes Swoosie Kurtz, Martha Plimpton, Harley Cross, Jamey Sheridan, Feodor Chaliapin. Based on the novel “Union Street” by Pat Barker, screenplay by Harriet Frank, Jr and Irving Ravetch.

results.title: Standing in the shadows of Motown [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Rimshot Productions, Sandy Passman and Paul Justman
results.brief_description: This award winning, acclaimed documentary is in part a biographical profile of the Funk Brothers, the Hitsville studio band originally assembled by Berry Gordy in 1959, who played behind numerous Motown Records hits, but whose talents went largely unsung. In this work remaining band members are reunited to reminisce about past glories and those departed, and in order to stage a concert that celebrates their contribution to music. Using archival footage, this work also addresses the cultural revolution of the rhythm and blues movement of the 1950s and the racism and inequities that saw the originators of the music, principally African Americans, languish whilst their white counterparts (such as Elvis Presley) prospered. In Detroit the Funk brothers overcame these hurdles with a new sound - known as Motown - that not only championed their artistry but also were phenomenally successful, producing hit after hit. Musicians featured in the reunion concert include: Joan Osborne, Ben Harper, Me’Shell Ndege Ocello, Chaka Khan, Bootsy Collins and the Funk Brothers.

results.title: Stand by me (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, ACT III Communications, Andrew Scheinman, Bruce A. Evans, Raynold Gideon and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1956, four youths set out on a two-day trek through the woods surrounding their home-town of Castle Rock, Oregon, to find the undiscovered body of a dead teenager reported missing for several days. Their adventure is filled with humour and suspense as they learn about friendship and growing up. Starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland, John Cusack and Richard Dreyfuss.

results.title: Stand and deliver
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Tom Musca and Ramon Menendez
results.brief_description: Edward James Olmos gives a widely-acclaimed performance as Jaime Escalante, a dedicated Maths teacher at a Los Angeles high school where most of the inner-city students are underachievers and come from poor Latin American families. Escalante refuses to see them as losers and cajoles, pushes and inspires his class to become Maths wizards and to pass a national exam which no student of the school has ever passed before. With Lou Diamond Phillips and Andy Garcia.

results.title: Stalag 17
results.brief_description: Set in a German prisoner-of-war camp, “Stalag 17” is about a group of American sergeants confined to one barrack, trying to survive wartime restrictions and spartan conditions. Amid the soldiers is one man, Sefton, a canny operator and racketeer who has amassed a case of contraband that enables him to bribe favours, providing him with more comfortable surrounds. When a meticulously planned escape is expertly foiled, the men suspect a traitor within the ranks; soon all suspicions turn to Sefton, whose compassion has been battered out of him after years as a POW, but could he be a Nazi collaborator? Effectively utilising the confines of the barrack as an incendiary setting for pent up frustrations, Wilder successfully explores the mob mentality in a compelling manner; less compelling (at least dramatically) are the humorous moments operating as light relief which stagnate the drama, diluting the well crafted tension. “Stalag 17” was one of the first films to convey war with humour - a definite precursor to “MASH”, “Catch-22” and the campy outlandishness of “Hogan’s Heroes”. William Holden won an Academy Award for his portrayal of the embittered Sefton - a role he apparently reluctantly played. Cast includes Don Taylor, Otto Preminger, Robert Strauss, Harvey Lembeck, Peter Graves, Richard Erdman, Sig Rumann and Neville Brand.

results.title: Stage Fright
results.creator_credit: Warner Brothers First National Productions and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: Drama student Eve Gill (Jane Wyman) envisions the acting challenge of a lifetime in the desperate predicament of boyfriend Jonathan Cooper (Richard Todd) who is framed for murder by the flamboyant stage star Charlotte Inwood (Marlene Dietrich). To prove Jonathan’s innocence, the naive Eve impersonates a maid and works for Charlotte but discovers that where murder is involved, life does not follow a script. Representing the glamour and bitchiness of the theatre, movie legend Marlene Dietrich makes the vain, manipulative Charlotte one of her most colourful characterisations and her rendition of Cole Porter’s “The Laziest gal in town” is both sexy and provocative. Co-starring Michael Wilding, Richard Todd, Alistair Sim, Sybil Thorndike, Joyce Grenfell and Kay Walsh. Based on a novel by Selwyn Jepson.
